datasets.name: Currents
datasets.toolTip: Water level, storm surge, tide and current forecasts by the Global Storm Surge Information System (GLOSSIS), which runs Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTMS) in real-time. This includes real-time forecasts at thousands of nearshore locations across the world. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about GLOSSIS and the GTSM, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

flowmapLayer._comment: this is only 1 timestep, this should be added by  querying the bucket for available tilesets

datasets.name: Water level
datasets.toolTip: Water level, storm surge, tide and current forecasts by the Global Storm Surge Information System (GLOSSIS), which runs Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTMS) in real-time. This includes real-time forecasts at thousands of nearshore locations across the world. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about GLOSSIS and the GTSM, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Surge Height
datasets.toolTip: Water level, storm surge, tide and current forecasts by the Global Storm Surge Information System (GLOSSIS), which runs Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTMS) in real-time. This includes real-time forecasts at thousands of nearshore locations across the world. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about GLOSSIS and the GTSM, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Tide
datasets.toolTip: Water level, storm surge, tide and current forecasts by the Global Storm Surge Information System (GLOSSIS), which runs Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTMS) in real-time. This includes real-time forecasts at thousands of nearshore locations across the world. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about GLOSSIS and the GTSM, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Maximum water levels
datasets.toolTip: Maximum water levels for return periods of 2 years, 5 years, 10 years, 25 years, 50 years, 75 years and 100 years, based on a reanalysis with Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTSM). The return periods are derived from a 38 year reanalysis with the GTSM, using ERA5 meteorology as input and with a Gumbel model fitted to the data. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about the GTSM, this reanalysis and further climate change scenarios carried out using this model.

datasets.name: Tidal indicators
datasets.toolTip: Tidal indicators as calculated using Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTSM). Included are the Highest Astronomical Tide (HAT), the Lowest Astronomical Tide (LAT), the Mean Higher High Water (MHHW), the Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW), the tidal range (Range) and the Mean Sea Level (MSL). See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about the GTSM, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Wind
datasets.toolTip: Surface wind forecasts from NOAA's Global Forecasting System (GFS). See https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/model-data/model-datasets/global-forcast-system-gfs for more information about NOAA's GFS model.

datasets.name: Waves
datasets.toolTip: Significant wave height forecasts NOAA's WaveWatch III model. See https://polar.ncep.noaa.gov/waves/ for more information about NOAA's WaveWatch III model.

datasets.name: Precipitation
datasets.toolTip: Precipitation forecasts by NOAA's Global Forecasting System (GFS). See https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/model-data/model-datasets/global-forcast-system-gfs for more information about NOAA's GFS model.

datasets.name: Air temperature
datasets.toolTip: Air temperature forecasts by NOAA's Global Forecasting System (GFS). See https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/model-data/model-datasets/global-forcast-system-gfs for more information about NOAA's GFS model.

datasets.name: Discharge
datasets.toolTip: Discharge forecasts by the Global Fluvial Forecasting System (GLOFFIS) run by Deltares, which runs global WFLOW models. This includes real-time forecasts at hundreds of locations across the world. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about GLOFFIS, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Wave and wind climate
datasets.toolTip: Analysed wind and wave data from the raw data of ECMWF (ERA5) and NCEP between 1979 until present. The following information will be presented with global coverage: Wind roses (wind speed and direction) and wave roses (wave height, period and direction) and 90th percentiles and extreme values (wind speed and wave height). See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about the MetOcean Database, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Bathymetry
datasets.toolTip: Topographic and bathymetric data from the General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO). GEBCO's gridded bathymetric data set, the GEBCO_2019 grid, is a global terrain model for ocean and land at 15 arc-second intervals, obtained from the  GEBCO Compilation Group (2019) GEBCO 2019 Grid (doi:10.5285/836f016a-33be-6ddc-e053-6c86abc0788e). See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about this dataset.

datasets.name: Elevation
datasets.toolTip: Merged open source topographic and bathymetric data from multiple sources. Topographic data includes: ALOS DSM, AHN Netherlands, Greenland DEM, USGS NED, Canadian DEM, Australian DEM, and REMA Mosaic. Bathymetric data from: GEBCO and EMODnet. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about this dataset.

datasets.name: Shoreline Monitor
datasets.toolTip: Satellite-derived shoreline change rates based on linear fit between 1984 and 2017 presented for every 500 m alongshore with global coverage. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about this dataset, and to find out more about its validity and quality.

datasets.name: Wave Height CHASM
datasets.toolTip: Wind and wave hindcast data for two Dutch (future) offshore wind farms (Ten Noorden van de Wadden and Hollandse Kust West) from the TKI Coupled High-resolution Atmosphere-Sea Modelling (CHASM) project (Whiffle and Deltares). This dataset includes 9 year of high-resolution (spatial and temporal) field and point data. See [this link](https://projecten.topsectorenergie.nl/projecten/coupled-high-resolution-atmosphere-sea-modelling-00029218) for more information. For instructions on how to obtain the data, see the [Deltares Data Portal](https://deltaresdata.openearth.eu/geonetwork/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/0bca9f82-00e0-4346-b164-fdc0aa043605).

datasets.name: Groundwater declining trend
datasets.toolTip: Drought indicators as calculated with the PCR-GLOBWB and MODFLOW models developed at Deltares and Utrecht University. Included are the Groundwater Declining Trend (GDT) and Evapotranspiration Deficit Index (ETDI). The indicators were developed as part of the COPERNICUS C3S Global Agriculture project. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about this project, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Evaporation deficit
datasets.toolTip: Drought indicators as calculated with the PCR-GLOBWB and MODFLOW models developed at Deltares and Utrecht University. Included are the Groundwater Declining Trend (GDT) and Evapotranspiration Deficit Index (ETDI). The indicators were developed as part of the COPERNICUS C3S Global Agriculture project. See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about this project, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Chlorophyll indicator
datasets.toolTip: Chlorophyll Indicator Data for phytoplankton growth season,  as six-year mean, and maximum expressed as P90. Based on blends of thousands of customised satellite datasets of concentration of chlorophyll pigment (CHL), which are indicative of phytoplankton standing stock in offshore, rocky, and turbid coastal waters. Typically, winter nutrients and multi-year chlorophyll statistics are evaluated against certain thresholds (assessment levels), to determine the ecological status of a marine area regarding eutrophication. We acknowledge CMEMS, ESA, EUMETSAT and Copernicus for satellite data. See https://www.deltares.nl/en/projects/msfd-eutro/  and http://www.openearth.nl/msfd-eutro/ for more information.

datasets.name: Corine
datasets.toolTip: Tidal indicators as calculated using Deltares' Global Tide and Surge Model (GTSM). Included are the Highest Astronomical Tide (HAT), the Lowest Astronomical Tide (LAT), the Mean Higher High Water (MHHW), the Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW), the tidal range (Range) and the Mean Sea Level (MSL). See [the Wiki](https://publicwiki.deltares.nl/display/BED/References) for further information about the GTSM, and to find out more about the validity and quality of this dataset.

datasets.name: Stream order
datasets.toolTip: Strahler stream order (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stream_order) and outline data based on a gridded representation of the earthsâ€™ rivers at resolutions from 30`` (~1 km) to 15` (~30 km) for use in distributed earth system models. The data is derived from the high resolution [MERIT Hydro dataset](http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~yamadai/MERIT_Hydro/index.html) and upscaled to model resolution using the Iterative Hydrography Upscaling (IHU) algorithm (https://hess.copernicus.org/preprints/hess-2020-582 ). The MERIT Hydro IHU visualizes the Strahler stream order which is a derivative of the flow direction. All data layers are available for download [here](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.430161) and are distributed under ODbL 1.0 License.
